title: How Did Sea Turtle Get a Straw Up Its Nose? - National Geographic
body: In a cringe-inducing video that's gone viral, a team of scientists spent nearly ten minutes pulling a plastic straw from the nostril of an olive ridley sea turtle.. At first, "it looked like a ...
readable_content: - National Geographic (2023-12-08): Scientists studying olive ridley sea turtles in Costa Rica recently helped an injured reptile with a straw stuck up its nose. The team of scientists spent nearly ten minutes removing the plastic straw from the nostril of the sea turtle. The researchers discovered that the straw had taken up the entire nostril, causing difficulty in breathing for the turtle. The team disinfected the turtle's nose and released it back into the ocean after ensuring its health. This incident emphasizes the impact of plastic waste on marine life and highlights the need to reduce plastic usage, particularly single-use items like straws.
summary:
The post highlights the harmful impact of plastic waste on marine life and emphasizes the importance of reducing plastic usage, particularly single-use items like straws. It conveys a sentiment of urgency and concern for the well-being of sea turtles and the broader marine ecosystem. 
Sentiment: 0.9
